messages.subject: grey hair/ makeup
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/16/03 6:10:45 PM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/16/03 6:10:45 PM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Count me in with the non-makeup wearing mamas. No nail polish either,
on fingers nor toes. I grew up believing that women "had" to wear
makeup and I wore it through high school. >>

See, and I wasn't allowed to. It was "wordly" and sinful.
So look at me now!! I use my face as a canvas for the most colorful, artful
stuff I can come up with (ok, some days I go more natural).
I like colorful streaks in my hair and tend to the funky side of makeup.

It's not a reaction to over control at this point. It's just ME. I am an
artist. I LOVE color and funk and all things artsy. So it makes sense that
I'd extend it to my body. :)

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
